definition: system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Cotton is woven into voile and then voile becomes material of clothes.
sentences.chinese: 棉花纺织成纱，它成为制衣的材料。

sentences.english: Changsha Changyang garment manufacture Co. Ltd. founded in Oct. 2001.
sentences.chinese: 长沙长阳制衣有限公司成立于2001年10月份。

sentences.english: Guangzhou Hongsheng Clothing factory is one logon clothing enterprise .
sentences.chinese: 广州市弘圣制衣厂，是一家注册服装企业。

sentences.english: I'm the sole representative of China Zhen Meili Clothing Copany. I'm glad to meet you.
sentences.chinese: 我是中国真美丽制衣公司的总代理，很高兴见到你。

sentences.english: A Scottish clothing company is producing the world's most expensive cloth.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰一家制衣厂生产出世界上最昂贵的衣服。

sentences.english: You do not walk through the clothing department petitioning against those ugly clothes.
sentences.chinese: 你不走，透过制衣署请愿，反对那些丑陋的衣服。

sentences.english: The Clothing Industry Training Authority (CITA) runs two training centres for the clothing and footwear industries.
sentences.chinese: 制衣业训练局辖下设有两所训练中心。

sentences.english: Threads of real gold were woven into the cloth for the royal garments .
sentences.chinese: 用来为王室制衣的布料织进了许许多多的真金丝线。

definition: to spin (cotton or hemp etc)/fine woven silk fabric
